title: How to Unblock a Number

steps.headline: Open the Phone app.
steps.description: It has an icon that resembles an old-fashioned phone. Tap this icon on your home screen or apps menu to open the Phone app. You can also tap the Messages app to unblocked numbers that have been blocked from sending text messages.

steps.headline: Tap ⋮.
steps.description: It's the icon with three vertical dots in the upper-right corner of the Phone app. It's next to the search bar at the top of the screen. This displays a drop-down menu. Note: The menu layouts and icons may be different depending on the make and model of your Android phone and your wireless carrier. If the icons or menu options are different on your phone, look for a similar option.

steps.headline: Tap Settings.
steps.description: It's the last option at the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.headline: Tap Call Blocking.
steps.description: It's at the top of the Settings menu in the Phone app. This displays a list of blocked numbers.

steps.headline: Tap x or - next to a number.
steps.description: Depending on the make and model of your phone you will either be asked to confirm if you want to unblock the number, or it will unblock the number. Depending on the make and model of your phone, an "x" or a "-" icon appears next to each number in the list of blocked numbers.

steps.headline: Tap Unblock.
steps.description: This confirms that you want to unblock the number. Any calls you received from the number while it was blocked will not appear in your list of recent calls. If you need assistance blocking numbers on your T-Mobile account, you can dial 611 using your Phone app or call 1-877-746-0909 to contact customer service.

Open the Settings menu {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7e\/Iphonesettingsappicon.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7e\/Iphonesettingsappicon.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

steps.description: The Settings menu is located on your home screen. It has a silver icon that resembles a gear within a gear.

steps.headline:
Scroll down and tap on Phone {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/36\/IPhonephone.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/36\/IPhonephone.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

steps.description: It's next to a green icon that has an image that resembles an old-fashioned phone. You can also tap the Messages, or Facetime option in the Settings menu if you want to unblock a number from sending text messages or Facetime chats.

steps.headline: Tap Call Blocking & Identification.
steps.description: It's under the Phone option in the Settings menu. This displays a list of all of your blocked numbers. Tap the Blocked option if you selected Messages or Facetime option in the Settings menu.

steps.headline: Tap the Edit button in the upper right-hand corner.
steps.description: This populates an icon that resembles a red circle with a horizontal line through it to the left of each number in your list of blocked numbers.

steps.headline:
Tap {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/64\/Iphoneremovewidget.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/64\/Iphoneremovewidget.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":406,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":670.5882352941177,"licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of an iOS icon.\n<\/p>

License: Fair Use<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} next to a number you want to unblock.
steps.description: This is the red circle icon with a horizontal line through it. This moves the number at the top of the page above all the other numbers in the list.

steps.headline: Tap Unblock.
steps.description: It's the red button next to the number at the top of the page next to the number you just removed from the list. This confirms that you want to unblock the number and allows you to receive calls from that number. If you need assistance blocking numbers on your T-Mobile account, you can dial 611 using your Phone app or call 1-877-746-0909 to contact customer service.

steps.headline: Go to https://www.verizonwireless.com/my-verizon using a web browser.
steps.description: You can use any web browser on your PC, Mac, or mobile phone.

steps.headline: Enter your User ID, and password and click Sign In.
steps.description: This logs you into your Verizon account on the website. You can also log in using your phone number in place of your User ID.

steps.headline: Click My Verizon.
steps.description: This displays the menu options for your Verizon account.

steps.headline: Click My Account.
steps.description: This displays your account details and options related to your account.

steps.headline: Click Manage Verizon Family Safeguards & Controls.
steps.description: This is available in your Verizon account options.

steps.headline: Click View Details and Edit.
steps.description: This allows you to view and edit your account safeguards and controls.

steps.headline: Click Controls.
steps.description: It's the second tab at the top of the "View Details and Edit" page. It's between the "Activity" and "Profiles" tabs. This displays a drop-down menu.

steps.headline: Click Blocked Contacts.
steps.description: It's in the "Controls" drop-down menu. This displays a list of blocked contacts on your Verizon account.

steps.headline: Click a blocked contact.
steps.description: Blocked contacts can be either phone numbers or email addresses.

steps.headline: Click Delete.
steps.description: This removes the number from the list of blocked contacts. If you need assistance, call 1-800-922-0204 to contact Verizon customer service. If you blocked calls from your phone, see Method 1 to learn how to unblock numbers from your Android phone. See Method 2 and to learn how to unblock numbers from an iPhone.

methods.name: Using the AT&T Call Protect App

steps.headline: Open the Call Protect app.
steps.description: It has an icon that resembles a shield with a yellow phone icon next to it. Tap the icon on your home screen or apps menu to open the app. It's available on iPhone and Android devices.

steps.headline: Tap the blocked icon.
steps.description: It's the icon that resembles a circle with a slash through it. The red blocked icon displays a list of calls that were automatically blocked. The black icon displays a list of calls that were manually blocked.

steps.headline: Tap a blocked number.
steps.description: This displays a page with the details about the number.

steps.headline: Tap Unblock.
steps.description: It's on the right side near the top of the page. This removes the number from the blocked list. If you need assistance, dial 611 using the phone app, or call 1-800-331-0500 to contact AT&T Wireless customer service. If you blocked calls from your phone app (Android) or Settings menu (iPhone), see Method 1 to learn how to unblock numbers from your Android phone. See Method 2 and to learn how to unblock numbers from an iPhone.

steps.headline: Dial *60 from an AT&T phone.
steps.description: You can use any touch-tone phone with AT&T service. This calls into AT&T's Selective Call Rejection System. On a rotary phone, dial 1160 and follow the prompts.

steps.headline: Dial * on the keypad.
steps.description: This is the menu option to unblock numbers that have been blocked in the Selective Call Rejection System.

steps.headline: Dial the number you want to unblock.
steps.description: Use the keypad to enter the 10-digit number you want to unblock.

steps.headline: Press # on the keypad.
steps.description: This confirms that you want to unblock the number and unblocks the number from the Selective Call Rejection System. You can now receive calls from that number. If you want to unblock all numbers simply dial *80 or 1180 after you call into the Selective Call Rejection System. If you need assistance, call 1-800-288-2020 to contact AT&T landline customer service.

steps.headline: Navigate to https://www.sprint.com/en/login.html using a web browser.
steps.description: You can use any web browser on PC, Mac, or your mobile phone.

steps.headline: Type your username and password and click Submit.
steps.description: Use the spaces provided on the web page to type the username and password associated with your Sprint account. Then click Submit. This logs you into your Sprint account on the website. If you do not have a sprint account click Sign Up on the right side of the screen. You must have service through Sprint to sign up for an account.

steps.headline: Click My Sprint.
steps.description: This displays menu options for your Sprint account.

steps.headline: Click Permissions.
steps.description: It's in the "My Sprint" menu options. There may be an authentication process. Have your account details ready and answer any questions to confirm your account.

steps.headline: Click Block voice.
steps.description: This displays a list of blocked numbers.

steps.headline: Click the number you wish to unblock.
steps.description: This displays an options menu next to the number. To unblock all numbers, click Do not block any voice calls. This archives all blocked calls so you can find them later.

steps.headline: Click Remove number.
steps.description: It's in the menu that appears when you click on a blocked number. This removes the number from the list of blocked numbers. If you need assistance, contact 1-888-211-4727 to contact Sprint customer service. If you blocked calls from your phone app (Android) or Settings menu (iPhone), see Method 1 to learn how to unblock numbers from your Android phone. See Method 2 and to learn how to unblock numbers from an iPhone.

tyn: A registered account with your service provider
text:
Using an Android with T-Mobile Open the Phone app. It has an icon that resembles an old-fashioned phone. Tap this icon on your home screen or apps menu to open the Phone app. You can also tap the Messages app to unblocked numbers that have been blocked from sending text messages. Tap ⋮. It's the icon with three vertical dots in the upper-right corner of the Phone app. It's next to the search bar at the top of the screen. This displays a drop-down menu. Note: The menu layouts and icons may be different depending on the make and model of your Android phone and your wireless carrier. If the icons or menu options are different on your phone, look for a similar option. Tap Settings. It's the last option at the bottom of the drop-down menu. Tap Call Blocking. It's at the top of the Settings menu in the Phone app. This displays a list of blocked numbers. Tap x or - next to a number. Depending on the make and model of your phone you will either be asked to confirm if you want to unblock the number, or it will unblock the number. Depending on the make and model of your phone, an "x" or a "-" icon appears next to each number in the list of blocked numbers. Tap Unblock. This confirms that you want to unblock the number. Any calls you received from the number while it was blocked will not appear in your list of recent calls. If you need assistance blocking numbers on your T-Mobile account, you can dial 611 using your Phone app or call 1-877-746-0909 to contact customer service. "} next to a number you want to unblock. This is the red circle icon with a horizontal line through it. This moves the number at the top of the page above all the other numbers in the list. Tap Unblock. It's the red button next to the number at the top of the page next to the number you just removed from the list. This confirms that you want to unblock the number and allows you to receive calls from that number. If you need assistance blocking numbers on your T-Mobile account, you can dial 611 using your Phone app or call 1-877-746-0909 to contact customer service. Using the Verizon Website Go to https://www.verizonwireless.com/my-verizon using a web browser. You can use any web browser on your PC, Mac, or mobile phone. Enter your User ID, and password and click Sign In. This logs you into your Verizon account on the website. You can also log in using your phone number in place of your User ID. Click My Verizon. This displays the menu options for your Verizon account. Click My Account. This displays your account details and options related to your account. Click Manage Verizon Family Safeguards & Controls. This is available in your Verizon account options. Click View Details and Edit. This allows you to view and edit your account safeguards and controls. Click Controls. It's the second tab at the top of the "View Details and Edit" page. It's between the "Activity" and "Profiles" tabs. This displays a drop-down menu. Click Blocked Contacts. It's in the "Controls" drop-down menu. This displays a list of blocked contacts on your Verizon account. Click a blocked contact. Blocked contacts can be either phone numbers or email addresses. Click Delete. This removes the number from the list of blocked contacts. If you need assistance, call 1-800-922-0204 to contact Verizon customer service. If you blocked calls from your phone, see Method 1 to learn how to unblock numbers from your Android phone. See Method 2 and to learn how to unblock numbers from an iPhone. Using the AT&T Call Protect App Open the Call Protect app. It has an icon that resembles a shield with a yellow phone icon next to it. Tap the icon on your home screen or apps menu to open the app. It's available on iPhone and Android devices. Tap the blocked icon. It's the icon that resembles a circle with a slash through it. The red blocked icon displays a list of calls that were automatically blocked. The black icon displays a list of calls that were manually blocked. Tap a blocked number. This displays a page with the details about the number. Tap Unblock. It's on the right side near the top of the page. This removes the number from the blocked list. If you need assistance, dial 611 using the phone app, or call 1-800-331-0500 to contact AT&T Wireless customer service. If you blocked calls from your phone app (Android) or Settings menu (iPhone), see Method 1 to learn how to unblock numbers from your Android phone. See Method 2 and to learn how to unblock numbers from an iPhone. Using an AT&T Landline Phone Dial *60 from an AT&T phone. You can use any touch-tone phone with AT&T service. This calls into AT&T's Selective Call Rejection System. On a rotary phone, dial 1160 and follow the prompts. Dial * on the keypad. This is the menu option to unblock numbers that have been blocked in the Selective Call Rejection System. Dial the number you want to unblock. Use the keypad to enter the 10-digit number you want to unblock. Press # on the keypad. This confirms that you want to unblock the number and unblocks the number from the Selective Call Rejection System. You can now receive calls from that number. If you want to unblock all numbers simply dial *80 or 1180 after you call into the Selective Call Rejection System. If you need assistance, call 1-800-288-2020 to contact AT&T landline customer service. Using the Sprint Website Navigate to https://www.sprint.com/en/login.html using a web browser. You can use any web browser on PC, Mac, or your mobile phone. Type your username and password and click Submit. Use the spaces provided on the web page to type the username and password associated with your Sprint account. Then click Submit. This logs you into your Sprint account on the website. If you do not have a sprint account click Sign Up on the right side of the screen. You must have service through Sprint to sign up for an account. Click My Sprint. This displays menu options for your Sprint account. Click Permissions. It's in the "My Sprint" menu options. There may be an authentication process. Have your account details ready and answer any questions to confirm your account. Click Block voice. This displays a list of blocked numbers. Click the number you wish to unblock. This displays an options menu next to the number. To unblock all numbers, click Do not block any voice calls. This archives all blocked calls so you can find them later. Click Remove number. It's in the menu that appears when you click on a blocked number. This removes the number from the list of blocked numbers. If you need assistance, contact 1-888-211-4727 to contact Sprint customer service. If you blocked calls from your phone app (Android) or Settings menu (iPhone), see Method 1 to learn how to unblock numbers from your Android phone. See Method 2 and to learn how to unblock numbers from an iPhone.
sentences: Using an Android with T-Mobile Open the Phone app.
It has an icon that resembles an old-fashioned phone.
Tap this icon on your home screen or apps menu to open the Phone app.
You can also tap the Messages app to unblocked numbers that have been blocked from sending text messages.
Tap ⋮.
It's the icon with three vertical dots in the upper-right corner of the Phone app.
It's next to the search bar at the top of the screen.
This displays a drop-down menu.
Note: The menu layouts and icons may be different depending on the make and model of your Android phone and your wireless carrier.
If the icons or menu options are different on your phone, look for a similar option.
Tap Settings.
It's the last option at the bottom of the drop-down menu.
Tap Call Blocking.
It's at the top of the Settings menu in the Phone app.
This displays a list of blocked numbers.
Tap x or - next to a number.
Depending on the make and model of your phone you will either be asked to confirm if you want to unblock the number, or it will unblock the number.
Depending on the make and model of your phone, an "x" or a "-" icon appears next to each number in the list of blocked numbers.
Tap Unblock.
This confirms that you want to unblock the number.
Any calls you received from the number while it was blocked will not appear in your list of recent calls.
If you need assistance blocking numbers on your T-Mobile account, you can dial 611 using your Phone app or call 1-877-746-0909 to contact customer service.

You can also tap the Messages, or Facetime option in the Settings menu if you want to unblock a number from sending text messages or Facetime chats.
Tap Call Blocking & Identification.
It's under the Phone option in the Settings menu.
This displays a list of all of your blocked numbers.
Tap the Blocked option if you selected Messages or Facetime option in the Settings menu.
Tap the Edit button in the upper right-hand corner.
This populates an icon that resembles a red circle with a horizontal line through it to the left of each number in your list of blocked numbers.

This is the red circle icon with a horizontal line through it.

Tap Unblock.
It's the red button next to the number at the top of the page next to the number you just removed from the list.
This confirms that you want to unblock the number and allows you to receive calls from that number.
If you need assistance blocking numbers on your T-Mobile account, you can dial 611 using your Phone app or call 1-877-746-0909 to contact customer service.
Using the Verizon Website Go to https://www.verizonwireless.com/my-verizon using a web browser.
You can use any web browser on your PC, Mac, or mobile phone.
Enter your User ID, and password and click Sign In.
This logs you into your Verizon account on the website.
You can also log in using your phone number in place of your User ID.
Click My Verizon.
This displays the menu options for your Verizon account.
Click My Account.
This displays your account details and options related to your account.
Click Manage Verizon Family Safeguards & Controls.
This is available in your Verizon account options.
Click View Details and Edit.
This allows you to view and edit your account safeguards and controls.
Click Controls.
It's the second tab at the top of the "View Details and Edit" page.
It's between the "Activity" and "Profiles" tabs.
This displays a drop-down menu.
Click Blocked Contacts.
It's in the "Controls" drop-down menu.
This displays a list of blocked contacts on your Verizon account.
Click a blocked contact.
Blocked contacts can be either phone numbers or email addresses.
Click Delete.
This removes the number from the list of blocked contacts.
If you need assistance, call 1-800-922-0204 to contact Verizon customer service.
If you blocked calls from your phone, see Method 1 to learn how to unblock numbers from your Android phone.
See Method 2 and to learn how to unblock numbers from an iPhone.
Using the AT&T Call Protect App Open the Call Protect app.
It has an icon that resembles a shield with a yellow phone icon next to it.
Tap the icon on your home screen or apps menu to open the app.
It's available on iPhone and Android devices.
Tap the blocked icon.
It's the icon that resembles a circle with a slash through it.
The red blocked icon displays a list of calls that were automatically blocked.
The black icon displays a list of calls that were manually blocked.
Tap a blocked number.
This displays a page with the details about the number.
Tap Unblock.
It's on the right side near the top of the page.
This removes the number from the blocked list.
If you need assistance, dial 611 using the phone app, or call 1-800-331-0500 to contact AT&T Wireless customer service.
If you blocked calls from your phone app (Android) or Settings menu (iPhone), see Method 1 to learn how to unblock numbers from your Android phone.
See Method 2 and to learn how to unblock numbers from an iPhone.
Using an AT&T Landline Phone Dial *60 from an AT&T phone.
You can use any touch-tone phone with AT&T service.
This calls into AT&T's Selective Call Rejection System.
On a rotary phone, dial 1160 and follow the prompts.
Dial * on the keypad.
This is the menu option to unblock numbers that have been blocked in the Selective Call Rejection System.
Dial the number you want to unblock.
Use the keypad to enter the 10-digit number you want to unblock.
Press # on the keypad.
This confirms that you want to unblock the number and unblocks the number from the Selective Call Rejection System.
You can now receive calls from that number.
If you want to unblock all numbers simply dial *80 or 1180 after you call into the Selective Call Rejection System.
If you need assistance, call 1-800-288-2020 to contact AT&T landline customer service.
Using the Sprint Website Navigate to https://www.sprint.com/en/login.html using a web browser.
You can use any web browser on PC, Mac, or your mobile phone.
Type your username and password and click Submit.
Use the spaces provided on the web page to type the username and password associated with your Sprint account.
Then click Submit.
This logs you into your Sprint account on the website.
If you do not have a sprint account click Sign Up on the right side of the screen.
You must have service through Sprint to sign up for an account.
Click My Sprint.
This displays menu options for your Sprint account.
Click Permissions.
It's in the "My Sprint" menu options.
There may be an authentication process.
Have your account details ready and answer any questions to confirm your account.
Click Block voice.
This displays a list of blocked numbers.
Click the number you wish to unblock.
This displays an options menu next to the number.
To unblock all numbers, click Do not block any voice calls.
This archives all blocked calls so you can find them later.
Click Remove number.
It's in the menu that appears when you click on a blocked number.
This removes the number from the list of blocked numbers.
If you need assistance, contact 1-888-211-4727 to contact Sprint customer service.
If you blocked calls from your phone app (Android) or Settings menu (iPhone), see Method 1 to learn how to unblock numbers from your Android phone.
See Method 2 and to learn how to unblock numbers from an iPhone.
